title: What's up with Yorick?
body: I don't understand. I've never played with or against a Yorick. I've never seen him in a free champion rotation, I've never seen any skins come out for him. I've never seen him played with or against before. I mean, is this guy even considered a champion anymore? I know some champions are generally unpopular, like Galio or Urgot, but this is a just pitiful. He's being completely ignored by not only Riot, but by the LoL community as a whole. His share of games has been a resident in the Top 5 lowest for longer than I can remember. I'm confused because when I first played Yorick, he was really fun. He seems just as good as any other champ, but yet he's so unrecognized. There have even been games where people didn't even know who Yorick was. There was new of a rework about 2 years ago but that just disappeared. All in all, I just want some answers as to what is going on with Yoric, and what we can expect in his future.

Fun fact, the quote is actually "Alas, poor Yorick! I knew him, Horatio. A fellow of infinite jest, of most excellent fancy." -Hamlet

He is the champion soonest to be slated for a redesign after his initial release.  And unfortunately his redesign is no small task, ideally requiring changes to the very game engine.

Literally only a few months after he was made, the developers admitted they probably shouldn't have released him until they had new UI and controls, which would allow for his real niche, that of a multi-minion mage, a necromancer, to actually work.  Even the tanky elements were added to him, they admitted, just so he would find a role because his mage role wasn't going to be fulfilling.  And he has now been in this state for... four years I think?   It's been too long for me to even remember.  

In that time he's never been terrible because of the tanky sustain elements, and in fact had a fairly lengthy stint as a competitive top a long long time ago.  But he has no supportive skills, no ability to gank, and no way to secure a kill.  He is pretty much about nothing but survive and deny, stagnating whatever lane he is in no matter the lane opponent.  However, this strategy started to become excessively dominant in the competitive scene, and he was not only nerfed, but most fighters since have been designed or redesigned to discourage any such stagnate bunker strategy from ever making a resurgence.

>ut most fighters since have been designed or redesigned to discourage any such stagnate bunker strategy from ever making a resurgence.

{{champion:201}}

In what imaginary world do you live in where Braum is a fighter?  He's a full on tanky support, and there are tons of supports that are based on stymying a lane, that's totally okay in a support role.  But you would get creamed, repeatedly, if you ever took him in to any lane and attempted to use the same bunkering strategy as a fighter.  In fact in Braums case you'd get creamed if you ever attempted to use him as a fighter period, leona kind of works as a fighter, as well as maokai and Alistar (once upon a time), but braum... there's just no way, he can't be anything but a support.

He's taken top as a counter to snowball champs like Riven and Ekko. His lvl 1 trades are a lot stronger than people realize thanks to his wall (30% damage reduction) and once he gets some health regen, he become an immovable object in lane.
Even if they push lane to tower, he can wall all damage off it while waiting for his own wave to arrive.

It's a niche pick taken with the sole purpose of stalling out a lane. And since he lacks any kill potential without a jungler (against a reasonably competent opponent), he fails in lanes against opponents that only care about farming (Susan and Signed).

Yorick is like Hufflepuff.
He dwells in the shadows, mostly going unrecognized.
People know he's there, but never allude to him.
Which is fine by Yorick.
**Because the more unnoticed he goes,
the more satisfying it is to lane against someone who doesn't know how to fight him.**

That being said, I don't own Yorick nor have I ever laned against one, and so my apologies are given to anyone that's ever had to lane against him and not known what to do. In all seriousness, he seems like a fun champ, and I'm surprised more people don't play him. Now if you excuse me, I have a 4800 IP underdog to save up for.

Then they dropped it and about two years later are saying they are beginning to come up with things for him. Nunu honestly doesn't get to do Nunu things to Yorick. If he goes to melee to proc his passive, Yorick can just drop his W on him, click on him with E, and by that point Nunu should be running already, unless he is super fed.

Early, and probably even in lane, Sion doesn't do well against Yorick. Most melee champs don't.

Out of the 4 you listed, from my playing a lot of Yorick, Nasus does great against him, if he can smack the ghouls, and isn't getting hit with his W. The other 3 don't do well in lane against Yorick.

The knocking back ghouls with Sion for example isn't actually the issue. The W drops and does damage. The ghoul staying out is sort of whatever after that point. The E ghoul is more for harass, and Q, again the ghoul isn't that important as what Q does otherwise. 


I get where you are coming from, and in theory it sounds good, but doesn't work out. For example:

If nunu uses consume on the ghoul, he won't have it for a minion, and he will need it to help grab the cannon for example, cause Yorick will be harassing him down since his auto is melee.

Sion is good after6-9, but early levels, Yorick will bully him with his W mostly, and his E will just be annoying (I rarely early level my Q until I have to against other melee champs).

Mao gets bullied as well, just in general. Since Yorick does AD with Manamune and the like, but his main Spell (his W) is ap, you can't really just build defense against him in lane, cause he will go around it and just change how he attacks.

Nasus will make Yorick's day miserable. Not cause of q'ing his ghouls, just how he plays, and his built in sustain, and the death patch he puts down.  The other 3 aren't a problem for him in lane.

I've heard about her rework before, but I don't know too much about it. What was the severity of it? I know she changed a lot, but does she have ANYTHING in common with the current one?

Her original Q was an AoE cone in front of her, her W was a Bond that either sped up you and an ally or slowed an enemy (No root like there is now, only a slow), and her E was a bubble like it is now minus the speed boost (Her W lost the speed boost for her E to get it in the rework).

Her R wasn't leveled, it simply scaled with level like the new Jayce rework, each of her abilities sclaed to to level 6 rather than 5, and she held 2 charges of her ult.

Mantra Q did the damage and healed all targets by a small amount and then a percent of missing health, mantra W gave boosted speed and even more slow (Generally useless), and Mantra E was the scariest thing alive since you'd Mantra E a tank, give him a bubble and explode a huge amount of damage around that tank, which was ESPECIALLY good with a Malph, Hec, or Alistar. 

Overall, the biggest changes were her Q and passive since her E still exploded, her W still slowed and did damage, and she had a mantra. She lost a charge of mantra for a much shorter CD, her passive became reduced CD on her R rather than giving her upwards of.. 80ish AP I think based on how low of health SHE was like an AP version of Tryn's Q or Maw, and her Q went from a cone in front of her to a skill shot (Pretty fast moving at that) explosion and the Mantra Q is now boosted damage rather than healing nearby enemies.

The BIGGEST change that a lot of people hated was the loss of her Fans. If you see a Karma with the skin that shows her fans, that was her ORIGINAL art and that's how she ACTUALLY looked and she had fans to use as weapons. Her Q used to toss a bunch of fans in a cone and her AA's had her waving them around.

I loved Karma pre-rework and I love her now.

>The BIGGEST change that a lot of people hated was the loss of her Fans.

Visually, it was the fans and the dress.
They went back a re-textured the fans into her classic skin's dance, and jury-rigged a dress onto her new rig.
But the fans were very iconic of her, and one of her strongest visual queues. (She was a politician and a commander, not a warrior and a brute.)

Lore wise, she lost her personality, mentality, and her background. She's still a leader from Ionia, but that's about it.

Her theme of duality was ignored; Riot going so far as to say she didn't have one (Scarizard specifically), even though it was clearly stated on her release and evident in everything she had.

They basically claimed that no single part of her kit was healthy for the game. They've since contradicted those claims many times over by reintroducing those very "problem elements".

Gameplay, she went from a hyper-scaling support/burst mage (never since repeated) to a generic poke mage. 

After they finished the ~~replacement~~ rework, they spent the next 5 or so *consecutive* patches reworking and buffing her new kit.
(And holy Teemo, did she get buffed. Release Skarma wasn't even viable in Bronze 13)

All of this on the wake of huge community backlash.

-----------------------------------

Skarma is basically an entirely different champion; and if released under a different name, nobody would be the wiser (Some of use still want the name changed).

To be honest, Yorick is one of my favorite champions. I absolutely love his kit. Whenever I try to pick him people bitch so much that it makes it not fun to select him. I can count the number of times I've seen a Yorick pick work for a team. He's the reason "win lane, lose game" is a phrase. It's not about his numbers, not really. They're okay. First, he's a melee champion with fantastic ranged harass and sustain, meaning that he can't really be strong at either.  Then, you really benefit from the tanky items and builds, making his build path confusing for newbies, as it can become very situational. Third, he does nothing for a team. At least nothing that other champions don't do as well if not better.  His lack of meaningful CC is exacerbated by his lack of mobility.

He's cool conceptually, but executed poorly by Riot. I like him, and I keep him in my pocket for those times where I have to shut down top lane no matter what, but he needs a rework. Not just a normal rework, the whole minion AI needs to be redone for him to work well.
